content:
SplitterPanel Class

Definition

Creates a panel that is associated with a SplitContainer.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.Designer("System.Windows.Forms.Design.SplitterPanelDesigner, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(false)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Windows.Forms.Docking(System.Windows.Forms.DockingBehavior.Never)]
public sealed class SplitterPanel : System.Windows.Forms.Panel

Remarks

The SplitterPanel is a member of its associated SplitContainer rather than being a member of the underlying form. At design time, the SplitterPanel is accessible through the Panel1 or Panel2 properties of SplitContainer.

Constructors

SplitterPanel(SplitContainer)

Initializes a new instance of the SplitterPanel class with its specified SplitContainer.

public SplitterPanel (System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer owner);
owner
SplitContainer

The SplitContainer that contains the SplitterPanel.

Properties

Anchor

Gets or sets how a SplitterPanel attaches to the edges of the SplitContainer. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Windows.Forms.AnchorStyles Anchor { get; set; }
Value
AnchorStyles

One of the AnchorStyles values.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

AutoSize

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the SplitterPanel is automatically resized to display its entire contents. This property is not relevant to this class.

public bool AutoSize { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the SplitterPanel is automatically resized; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

AutoSizeMode

Enables the SplitterPanel to shrink when stem.Windows.Forms.SplitterPanel.AutoSize* is true. This property is not relevant to this class.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode AutoSizeMode { get; set; }
Value
AutoSizeMode

One of the AutoSizeMode values. The default is AutoSizeMode.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

BorderStyle

Gets or sets the border style for the SplitterPanel. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Windows.Forms.BorderStyle BorderStyle { get; set; }
Value
BorderStyle

One of the BorderStyle values.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

DefaultMargin 

protected override System.Windows.Forms.Padding DefaultMargin { get; }
Value
Padding

To be added.

Dock

Gets or sets which edge of the SplitContainer that the SplitterPanel is docked to. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle Dock { get; set; }
Value
DockStyle

One of the DockStyle values.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

DockPadding

Gets the internal spacing between the SplitterPanel and its edges. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges DockPadding { get; }
Value

A ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges that represents the padding for all the edges of a docked control.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

Height

Gets or sets the height of the SplitterPanel.

public int Height { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The height of the SplitterPanel, in pixels.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

The height cannot be set.

Location

Gets or sets the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the SplitterPanel relative to the upper-left corner of its SplitContainer. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Drawing.Point Location { get; set; }
Value
Point

The Point that represents the upper-left corner of the SplitterPanel relative to the upper-left corner of its SplitContainer.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

MaximumSize

Gets or sets the size that is the upper limit that stem.Windows.Forms.Control.GetPreferredSize* can specify. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Drawing.Size MaximumSize { get; set; }
Value
Size

An ordered pair of type Size representing the width and height of a rectangle.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

MinimumSize

Gets or sets the size that is the lower limit that stem.Windows.Forms.Control.GetPreferredSize* can specify. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Drawing.Size MinimumSize { get; set; }
Value
Size

An ordered pair of type Size representing the width and height of a rectangle.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

The width cannot be set.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

Name

The name of this SplitterPanel. This property is not relevant to this class.

public string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

A String representing the name of this SplitterPanel.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

Parent

Gets or sets the SplitContainer that contains this SplitterPanel. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Windows.Forms.Control Parent { get; set; }
Value
Control

A Control representing the SplitContainer that contains this SplitterPanel.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

Size

Gets or sets the height and width of the SplitterPanel. This property is not relevant to this class.

public System.Drawing.Size Size { get; set; }
Value
Size

The Size that represents the height and width of the SplitterPanel in pixels.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

TabIndex

Gets or sets the tab order of the SplitterPanel within its SplitContainer. This property is not relevant to this class.

public int TabIndex { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The index value of the SplitterPanel within the set of other SplitterPanel objects within its SplitContainer that are included in the tab order.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

TabStop

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this SplitterPanel using the TAB key. This property is not relevant to this class.

public bool TabStop { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the user can give the focus to this SplitterPanel using the TAB key; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

Visible

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the SplitterPanel is displayed. This property is not relevant to this class.

public bool Visible { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the SplitterPanel is displayed; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

Width

Gets or sets the width of the SplitterPanel.

public int Width { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The width of the SplitterPanel in pixels.
